turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Willyou consider finding part of your hot payment t_ charity?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It depends on the charity and whether or not I think it's a good cause.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Totally fair.  I hoped you'd say that because people who care where the money goes will love helping children with Save The Children

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Do you know any more about the charity? What exactly do they do?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: For starters,  they are an international organization (non-governmental) that promotes children's rights

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What kinds of things do they do to promote children's rights? Where does the money go when it is sent to that charity?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Here's the good part: the turk researchers collectthe money from the hits and sendit directly t_ the charity.  Ther problem is,  so many kids are in war zones,  food deserts,  and other tough areas.  Save The Children is there t_ defend them

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I get that, and I think it's great, but I am just very careful who I donate to. So how do they defend them?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: One thing they do is build shelters sothey havea place to live.   That alone is a near miracle for so many of these kids.  Hey,  check this site out  URL

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Do you know if they provide a way for the next generation of these children to get out of poverty and the poverty mindset? Like instead of giving someone a fish for dinner, teach them how to fish sort of thing?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Gh ets the first step for a charity likethis.  When kids are fed and sheltered theyare healthy.  That lets them learn.  So,  Save The Children had literacy and learning programs they use with the kids

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's great. It sounds similar to an organization I've been donating to for over a decade. Have you ever heard of Compassion International?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes!  I considered a child through them for several years.  I used to send him Christmas presents and such aloooong with monthly donations.   The two charities are very similar

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's wonderful. I actually sponsor three children through them now. Two years ago I was able to go and visit one of the girls I sponsor in Peru. It was the most surreal experience and made it so much more real seeing how my money had helped her life. I also got to see firsthand what the organization does with the children.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That is awesome!  Experiences like that are great for the giver and the kids.   It's sad t_ see what they have to deal with even after help, many times.  You've seen this first hand so you probably wouldn't have any problem with giving STC 0.50 from the hit payment,  right?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Sure, I can give 0.50 to the save the children organization.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's very niceof you!  I appreciate that.   It's a cliche but it's true,  0.50 doesn't mean much to us but it really does matter for these kids.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I agree with that. It goes a long way in another country.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes!  I know you already sponsor,  but would you look at the STC website and consider donating to them in ther future?  It seems like everyone wantsto helpbut thre is a lot more need than funds

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will agree to look at it, sure.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thank you so much.  I hope that youget to see all of your donations meet needs no matter who theyare to.  Thank you for the donations you've made ti sponsor ids already.  No matter whothe donationsgo through, the kids really benefit!
